p: Figure 4 shows a typical example of the evanescent wave spectroscopy that measured absorption features of the conducted a porphyrin dye compound using a hard-clad multimode silica optical fibre (core diameter, 200 ± 5 µm; cladding diameter 225 ± 5 µm, coating diameter 500 ± 30 µm, Pure Silica/TECS Hard Cladding Tefzel, FT200UMT, Thorlab) with a section of the plastic cladding removed [ 37]. Figure 4b demonstrates the absorption features of the porphyrin dye compounds located at ca. 420, 494 and 710 nm.
